segments.text: There is a tornado warning on . My mother just told me she heard it on the radio .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What is a tornado warning ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It means that a tornado has been seen somewhere in the area .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Really ? In New Berlin ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No . Not necessarily in town . But in southern Wisconsin somewhere . A tornado has been spotted . They have two stages here.This is what is called a " tornado watch . " That means that the weather conditions are perfect for a tornado .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I understand . They think a tornado might come .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . People should look out , because maybe there will be tornadoes coming.So it's called a " watch . "
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: And the second stage is called a " tornado warning " .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . If a tornado has been spotted , they announce a " tornado warning " . So if there's a tornado warning on , it means a tornado is out there somewhere .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's scary .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well . Tornadoes can be dangerous , it's true.If we hear something like a loud train coming , then we have to go in the basement .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What do you mean " a loud train " ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That is what tornadoes sound like . They sound like trains . They're very loud .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But if you hear them coming , isn't it already too late ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Maybe . It depends on the tornado.Some can move across the ground at 200 miles an hour.That is very fast . Others aren't so fast .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Have you seen a lot of them ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I've only seen one in my life . I was looking out the window . It was around two miles away . It was very interesting to watch.But it was heading toward my friend's house . So I quickly called them on the phone .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Did it hit their house ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , it didn't . But they are glad I called them .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What were they doing when you called ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They were all sitting in the living room watching TV.They had no idea a tornado was coming toward their house.If it had hit them , they could have all been killed .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's terrible . Do many people die in tornadoes ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Not so many really . But a lot of houses are destroyed sometimes .
segments.speaker: S1
